Description: Amulet of Anubis: an Anubis jackal in high relief, recumbent on a slender base, faces right; the tail flares out sharply. The irregular and extensive background in translucent emerald-green glass is the overflow area from the moulding which was not cut off.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (1994): fig.66
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
